Uses of Class
world.Point

  • Packages that use Point 
    Package Description
    utilities.maths  
    world  
    world.action  

    • Uses of Point in utilities.maths

      Methods in utilities.maths that return Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point ParametricLine.getP0()
      Returns the source point (x0, y0).
      Point ParametricLine.getP1()
      Returns the destination point (x1, y1).
      Point ParametricLine.intersect(ParametricLine line)
      Returns the intersection point of the current line and the specified line.
      Methods in utilities.maths with parameters of type Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double Math.getEuclidianDistance(Point p0, Point p1)
      Returns the Euclidian distance between the 2 points p0 and p1.
      static ParametricLine Math.getLine(Point p0, Point p1)
      Returns the Parametric line from point p0 to p1.

    • Uses of Point in world

      Methods in world that return Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point Snowball.getDestination()
      Returns the destination where the snowball will land.
      Point Snowball.getOrientation()
      Returns the unit vector (length of 1) of the orientation of the snowball.
      Point Player.getOrientation()
      Returns the unit vector (length of 1) of the orientation of the player.
      Point Entity.getPoint()
      Returns the position of the entity.
      Point Team.getStartingPosition()
      Returns the starting position of the team in the map
      Point[] Wall.getVertices()
      Returns the list of vertices in clockwise order.
      Methods in world with parameters of type Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Map.isCrossingWall(Point source, Point destination)
      Returns whether the line (source, destination) is crossing a wall or not.
      boolean Wall.isPointInWall(Point point)
      Returns whether the point is inside the wall or not.
      boolean Map.isPointInWall(Point point)
      Returns whether the point is in a wall or not.
      boolean Player.wouldHitPlayer(Player player, Point destination)
      Returns whether the player can hit the specified player if he shoots at the specified destination.
      Constructors in world with parameters of type Point 
      Constructor and Description
